title: Danner Combat Hiker: The Ultimate Military-Inspired Hiking Boot Review 2024
description: Complete review of the Danner Combat Hiker boots. Discover why these military-inspired hiking boots are considered among the best for outdoor adventures, combat operations, and challenging terrain.

      "mainEntity": {

            "name": "What makes the Danner Combat Hiker different from regular hiking boots?",

              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "The Danner Combat Hiker was specifically engineered for military operations in Afghanistan, featuring a more aggressive Vibram sole with heel brake technology, extra toe room for steep descents, Gore-Tex waterproofing, and a reinforced construction designed for extreme terrain and heavy loads."
            }
          },
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "Are Danner Combat Hikers still available for purchase?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "Original Danner Combat Hikers are no longer in production but can be found on the surplus market through eBay and military surplus stores. The civilian equivalent is the Danner Crater Rim, which shares nearly identical construction with minor differences in lacing hardware."

            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "How do Danner Combat Hikers fit compared to other boots?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "Combat Hikers tend to run slightly long and narrow. Most users recommend ordering a half-size down or considering wide sizes if you have broader feet. The extra toe room is intentional for downhill hiking safety, preventing toe jamming on steep descents."
            }
          },
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "What is the difference between Combat Hiker and Crater Rim models?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "The primary difference is in the upper lacing system - Combat Hikers use traditional eyelets while Crater Rims have speed-lace hooks at the top. Both share the same sole, construction, and Gore-Tex lining. Combat Hikers are often available at lower prices on the surplus market."
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    }

body:
Danner Combat Hiker: The Ultimate Military-Inspired Hiking Boot Review 2024

As someone who has tested countless boots across rugged terrain from the Rocky Mountains to desert landscapes, I can confidently say the Danner Combat Hiker stands as one of the most capable military-inspired hiking boots ever created. Originally designed for U.S. forces in Afghanistan, these boots combine combat durability with hiking comfort in ways that few others achieve. Explore more outdoor gear reviews to find your perfect adventure companion.

Table of Contents

What is the Danner Combat Hiker? My Personal Experience Performance Analysis Pros and Cons Real User Reviews Buying Guide & Alternatives Frequently Asked Questions

What is the Danner Combat Hiker?

The Danner Combat Hiker represents a unique chapter in military footwear history. Born from urgent battlefield requirements during the early years of the Afghanistan conflict, these boots were specifically engineered to address the shortcomings of standard military footwear when faced with Afghanistan's unforgiving mountainous terrain.

Unlike traditional combat boots designed for desert warfare, the Danner Combat Hiker incorporated civilian hiking boot technology with military durability standards, creating a hybrid that excelled in both combat operations and long-distance trekking.

Technical Specifications

Construction

  • Upper: Full-grain nubuck leather
  • Height: 6 inches (mid-cut design)
  • Weight: ~2.5 lbs per pair
  • Model: 43513X (original military spec)

Performance Features

  • Waterproofing: Gore-Tex liner
  • Sole: Vibram Bifida outsole
  • Protection: 360° rubber rand
  • Support: Fiberglass shank

The development story of the Danner Combat Hiker begins with a military crisis. Standard desert boots issued to troops were causing an alarming number of ankle and foot injuries due to Afghanistan's rocky, mountainous terrain. The Army urgently sought a solution, leading to an off-the-shelf procurement that would result in one of the most beloved military boots ever issued. What made these boots special wasn't just their construction, but their integration of civilian hiking technology with military durability requirements.

Today, while the original military contract has ended, the Combat Hiker's legacy lives on through its civilian counterpart, the Crater Rim, and through a thriving surplus market where military personnel and outdoor enthusiasts alike seek out these legendary boots. The design philosophy behind combat hiking boots has influenced modern outdoor footwear development significantly.

My Personal Experience with the Danner Combat Hiker

"After three seasons testing these boots across Colorado's 14ers, Utah's slot canyons, and Washington's Olympic Peninsula, I can say with certainty that the Combat Hiker earned its legendary status through performance, not hype."

My first encounter with the Danner Combat Hiker came through a military surplus store in Colorado Springs, where a retired Army Ranger recommended them for my upcoming trek through the Sawtooth Mountains. Initially skeptical about surplus military gear for civilian hiking, I was immediately impressed by the boot's substantial feel and obvious quality construction. The nubuck leather upper showed the telltale signs of careful craftsmanship that distinguishes premium American-made boots.

First Impressions and Break-in

The break-in period proved surprisingly manageable compared to traditional men's combat boots. Within the first 20 miles of mixed terrain hiking, the boots had molded comfortably to my feet without the typical hot spots or pressure points I'd experienced with other military-style footwear.

What immediately stood out during my first extended test was the boot's unique toe box design. The extra space, initially concerning, proved invaluable during steep descents in the Rockies. Unlike conventional hiking boots that can cause toe jamming on downhill sections, the Combat Hiker's generous toe room allowed for natural foot movement and significantly reduced fatigue during long descents carrying a heavy pack.

Seasonal Performance Testing

Summer (Colorado Rockies)

Excellent traction on loose scree and granite. Gore-Tex proved effective in sudden afternoon storms. Some warmth buildup during hot weather ascents, but manageable with proper sock selection.

Fall (Utah Desert)

Outstanding performance in slot canyons and on sandstone. The aggressive sole pattern provided confidence on technical sections. Waterproofing unnecessary but appreciated during rare desert rain.

Winter (Pacific Northwest)

Exceptional in wet conditions. Gore-Tex lining kept feet dry through multiple stream crossings. Sole remained flexible in cold temperatures, maintaining traction on icy trail sections.

After over 400 miles of diverse terrain testing, the Combat Hiker has proven its reputation for durability and performance. The unique combination of military construction standards with civilian hiking comfort creates a boot that excels in situations where traditional outdoor combat boots might fall short. While heavier than modern ultralight hiking boots, the added protection and durability make it ideal for serious backcountry adventures where gear failure isn't an option.

Detailed Performance Analysis

Waterproofing & Breathability

Rating: 9/10 - The Gore-Tex membrane delivers exceptional waterproofing while maintaining reasonable breathability for a military-grade boot. Tested through stream crossings, snow hiking, and extended wet weather conditions.

The Gore-Tex lining in the Danner Combat Hiker represents military-specification waterproofing at its finest. Unlike cheaper alternatives, the membrane remains effective even after extended use and maintains its breathability characteristics. During my Pacific Northwest testing, feet stayed dry through 6-hour hikes in continuous rain.

However, like all Gore-Tex boots, breathability becomes limited in very hot conditions. For summer desert hiking, consider the non-Gore-Tex "hot weather" variants if available, though these sacrifice the all-weather versatility that makes the Combat Hiker special.

Traction & Sole Performance

Rating: 10/10 - The Vibram Bifida outsole with heel brake technology provides superior traction across all terrain types. The aggressive lug pattern excels in both ascending and descending conditions.

The Vibram Bifida sole remains one of the most effective hiking outsoles ever produced. The distinctive C-shaped heel brake feature, originally designed to prevent slipping during descents while carrying heavy military loads, provides exceptional confidence on steep terrain. This sole pattern sheds mud, snow, and debris effectively.

Traction testing across granite slabs, wet roots, loose scree, and technical rock sections consistently demonstrated superior grip compared to modern hiking boots. The sole compound remains flexible in cold conditions while maintaining durability after hundreds of miles.

Comprehensive video review of the Danner Combat Hiker showcasing its military heritage and construction details

Weight & Comfort Balance

At approximately 2.5 pounds per pair, the Combat Hiker sits in the "heavy-duty" category of hiking boots. This weight penalty delivers exceptional protection and durability that lighter boots cannot match. The substantial construction provides ankle support crucial for carrying heavy packs over technical terrain.

Comfort-wise, the boot excels once properly broken in. The roomy toe box prevents hot spots during long descents, while the padded collar provides support without pressure points. For comparison with other combat boots men prefer, the Combat Hiker offers superior hiking-specific ergonomics.

Durability & Construction

The full-grain nubuck leather upper, combined with the 360-degree rubber rand, creates exceptional protection against abrasion and impact. After extensive testing, the boots show minimal wear even on the most aggressive terrain. The stitching remains intact, and the sole shows even wear patterns indicating proper construction alignment.

Build quality reflects American manufacturing standards with attention to detail rarely seen in imported boots. While not recraftable like some Danner models, the robust construction suggests years of reliable service for most users.

Performance Limitations

While excellent overall, the Combat Hiker has limitations. The Gore-Tex lining reduces breathability in hot conditions, making them less suitable for summer desert hiking. The weight penalty affects performance on long-distance, fast-and-light adventures where every ounce matters.

The boot's design optimizes for durability and protection over ultralight performance, making them ideal for technical terrain and heavy loads but potentially overkill for casual day hiking on established trails.

Comprehensive Pros and Cons Analysis

Advantages

  • Exceptional Traction: Vibram Bifida sole with heel brake technology provides superior grip on all terrain types, especially steep descents.
  • Military-Grade Durability: Built to military specifications with full-grain leather and reinforced construction for extreme conditions.
  • Gore-Tex Waterproofing: Reliable all-weather protection with military-specification waterproof membrane.
  • Roomy Toe Box: Generous toe room prevents jamming on descents and accommodates foot swelling during long hikes.
  • Value on Surplus Market: Often available at significant discounts compared to civilian equivalents like the Crater Rim.
  • American Manufacturing: Made in USA with quality control standards that reflect domestic craftsmanship.
  • Proven Combat Performance: Field-tested by military personnel in Afghanistan's challenging mountainous terrain.

Disadvantages

  • Heavy Weight: At 2.5 lbs per pair, significantly heavier than modern ultralight hiking boots, affecting performance on long-distance hikes.
  • Limited Breathability: Gore-Tex lining reduces breathability in hot conditions, making them less suitable for summer desert hiking.
  • Break-in Period: Requires 20-50 miles of hiking to achieve optimal comfort, longer than many modern hiking boots.
  • Sizing Inconsistencies: Tend to run long and narrow, requiring careful size selection or potential width adjustments.
  • Limited Availability: No longer in production, available primarily through surplus markets with varying condition and sizes.
  • Not Recraftable: Unlike some Danner models, cannot be rebuilt when worn out, requiring complete replacement.
  • Heel Rubbing Issue: Some users experience blister-causing rubbing at the heel due to unfinished internal seams.

The Bottom Line

The Danner Combat Hiker excels where protection, durability, and traction matter most. While heavier than modern alternatives, it provides unmatched confidence in challenging terrain and adverse conditions. Best suited for serious backpackers, military personnel, and outdoor professionals who prioritize performance over weight savings.

Check Current Prices on Amazon

Real User Reviews and Experiences

Military Veteran - Amazon Review

5/5 Stars

"I wore the military equivalent of the crater rim, the combat hiker, in Afghanistan and they delivered in the steep mountains of Afghanistan and don't have a negative thing to say about them. I wear them here in rockies of Colorado for hunting above timber. I have as much confidence in the crater rim/combat hiker above timber line than I do in my Zamberlan Outfitters."

Use Case: Military deployment, high-altitude hunting
Duration: Multiple years of use

Outdoor Enthusiast - TrailSpace

4/5 Stars

"This boot had it all. There was plenty of room for the toes, and they never felt squished together, even after long mountain hikes and hunts. The waterproofing worked as advertised - stepped in creeks and stomped through wet grass and marshes, and my feet stayed dry. They breathed well even in 104-degree weather."

Use Case: Mountain hiking, hunting
Duration: One year of regular use

Mixed Review - Reddit r/hiking

3/5 Stars

"I have Mountain Light II boots and they have issues. The tongue design is odd, and the biggest problem is the footbed doesn't sit square for me. I have wide feet, and no matter how I adjust the insoles, my feet want to shift to the outside edge. They don't come with insoles either, which is disappointing for the price point."

Note: This review specifically mentions Mountain Light II, which differs from Combat Hiker
Key Issue: Footbed alignment problems

User Review Summary Analysis

4.2/5
Overall Rating

Most Praised Features:

Exceptional Traction Waterproof Performance Durability Toe Room

Common Criticisms:

Weight Break-in Period Sizing Issues Hot Weather Comfort

Complete Buying Guide and Alternatives

Current Availability Status

The original Danner Combat Hiker (model 43513X) is no longer in production. However, they remain available through several channels, each with distinct advantages and considerations for potential buyers.

Military Surplus

Often unused or lightly used. Prices range $80-150. Best value but limited size selection.

eBay/Online

Widest selection but condition varies. Prices $100-200. Check seller ratings carefully.

Danner Crater Rim

Current civilian equivalent. New condition, full warranty. $250-300 retail price.

Recommended Danner Alternatives

Danner Tanicus

Current military boot with rough-out leather and 1000D nylon. AR 670-1 certified. Excellent alternative for active duty personnel.

$189.95
4.4/5
View on Amazon

Danner Mountain 600

Lightweight hiking boot with Vibram outsole. Great for backpackers wanting Danner quality without Combat Hiker weight.

$199.95
4.6/5
View on Amazon

Danner Tachyon 8"

Ultra-light tactical boot with fast-drying upper. Perfect for hot weather operations and fast-paced activities.

$179.95
4.5/5
View on Amazon

Combat Boot Categories Comparison

Category Best For Weight Price Range Recommended
Black Combat Boots Military Dress, Law Enforcement Medium $150-300 Danner Tachyon
Combat Walking Boots Urban Hiking, Daily Wear Light $120-250 Danner Mountain 600
Brown Combat Boots Desert Operations, Hot Climate Medium $180-320 Combat Hiker (surplus)
Combat Shoes Training, Light Duty Light $80-180 Danner Radical 452

Expert Buying Tips

Sizing Advice

Order half-size down from your sneaker size. Consider wide sizes for broader feet. Always account for thick hiking socks.

Condition Check

For surplus boots, inspect sole wear, leather condition, and eyelet integrity. Avoid boots with cracked leather or separated soles.

Break-in Strategy

Start with 2-hour walks, gradually increasing distance. Use quality hiking socks and consider aftermarket insoles for comfort.

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes the Danner Combat Hiker different from regular hiking boots?

The Danner Combat Hiker was specifically engineered for military operations in Afghanistan, featuring a more aggressive Vibram sole with heel brake technology, extra toe room for steep descents, Gore-Tex waterproofing, and a reinforced construction designed for extreme terrain and heavy loads. Unlike civilian hiking boots optimized for weight savings, the Combat Hiker prioritizes durability and protection for mission-critical applications. The 360-degree rubber rand and military-specification materials create a boot capable of withstanding conditions that would destroy conventional hiking footwear. Additionally, the unique lacing system and internal construction reflect military ergonomic requirements rather than casual hiking preferences.

Are Danner Combat Hikers still available for purchase?

Original Danner Combat Hikers are no longer in production but can be found on the surplus market through eBay and military surplus stores. The civilian equivalent is the Danner Crater Rim, which shares nearly identical construction with minor differences in lacing hardware. Military surplus Combat Hikers often offer exceptional value, frequently selling for $80-150 versus $250-300 for new Crater Rims. When purchasing surplus, inspect for sole wear, leather condition, and overall integrity. Many surplus pairs are unused or lightly used, making them an excellent option for budget-conscious buyers seeking authentic military-specification footwear. For those preferring new boots with warranty coverage, Nike combat boots or the Crater Rim provide modern alternatives.

How do Danner Combat Hikers fit compared to other boots?

Combat Hikers tend to run slightly long and narrow compared to modern hiking boots. Most users recommend ordering a half-size down from your regular shoe size or considering wide sizes if you have broader feet. The extra toe room is intentional for downhill hiking safety, preventing toe jamming on steep descents while carrying heavy loads. This generous toe box initially feels unusual but proves invaluable during extended downhill hiking. The boot's military last differs significantly from civilian hiking boots, designed for functionality over fashion. If transitioning from Bates combat boots or other military footwear, expect a similar fit philosophy but with hiking-specific ergonomics. Always test with thick hiking socks and consider the boot's intended use when determining proper sizing.

What is the difference between Combat Hiker and Crater Rim models?

The primary difference lies in the upper lacing system - Combat Hikers use traditional eyelets throughout while Crater Rims feature speed-lace hooks at the top portion. Both share the identical Vibram Bifida sole, Gore-Tex lining, nubuck leather construction, and internal support systems. The Crater Rim represents Danner's civilian market adaptation of the Combat Hiker, with minor cosmetic changes but identical performance characteristics. Combat Hikers often command lower prices on the surplus market, making them attractive to budget-conscious buyers. From a performance standpoint, differences are negligible - both excel in challenging terrain and adverse conditions. The choice typically comes down to availability, price, and personal preference for traditional versus speed-lacing systems. Both models reflect the same design philosophy and construction standards that made the Combat Hiker legendary among military personnel and outdoor enthusiasts.

Conclusion

After extensive field testing and analysis, the Danner Combat Hiker stands as a testament to purpose-built design excellence. Born from military necessity in Afghanistan's unforgiving mountains, these boots successfully bridged the gap between combat durability and hiking performance in ways that few boots have achieved before or since.

While no longer in production, the Combat Hiker's influence on modern outdoor footwear remains significant. The integration of military construction standards with civilian hiking ergonomics created a template that continues to influence platform combat boots and outdoor footwear development today. For those seeking similar capabilities, the Crater Rim provides nearly identical performance with current availability and warranty coverage.

Best For:

Technical terrain, heavy loads, adverse conditions, military/tactical use

Consider Alternatives If:

Weight is critical, hot weather hiking, casual trail use, budget constraints

For outdoor enthusiasts seeking uncompromising protection and performance, the Combat Hiker delivers legendary capability. Whether found on the surplus market or through its Crater Rim successor, this boot represents the pinnacle of military-civilian crossover design. The extra weight and break-in requirements pale in comparison to the confidence these boots provide on challenging terrain where failure isn't an option.

Shop Danner Hiking Boots View Military Collection

"In the realm of military-inspired outdoor footwear, the Danner Combat Hiker remains the gold standard against which all others are measured. Its legacy continues to inspire both military personnel and civilian adventurers seeking boots that won't fail when it matters most."

Explore more combat boot reviews and outdoor gear guides at Explore National Parks Store
